messages.text:
It should rebuild from scratch every 24 hours the first week after a release was tagged, to cover cases where binaries change shortly after release.

I misread the GH API docs, the endpoint I used doesn't include pre-releases. I had previously only tested it with full releases. My bad :face_palm: Should be a relatively quick fix.

---

I triggered a manual rebuild ~5 hours ago when someone reported that issue in the setup-julia repo and the rebuilt file includes the correct hash `7e6a0298eebe48d408279c6f99cb5df575b39097c44846971e5851a4daf25f0a`, so I think the issue should be resolved now

elements.text:

I misread the GH API docs, the endpoint I used doesn't include pre-releases. I had previously only tested it with full releases. My bad

Should be a relatively quick fix.

---

I triggered a manual rebuild ~5 hours ago when someone reported that issue in the setup-julia repo and the rebuilt file includes the correct hash
, so I think the issue should be resolved now

messages.text: I want to make a pretty quick RC3 because RC2 was pretty broken on Windows (seems our CI doesn't catch that unfortunately). Therefore the RC2 will not get proper testing now on Windows since people are unlikely to use it. Any opinions on a quick RC3?

elements.text: I want to make a pretty quick RC3 because RC2 was pretty broken on Windows (seems our CI doesn't catch that unfortunately). Therefore the RC2 will not get proper testing now on Windows since people are unlikely to use it. Any opinions on a quick RC3?

elements.text: No opposition from me, but it would be nice to figure out how we can test the Windows issue on CI

elements.text: Not a blocker for RC3, we just need someone on Windows to test manually

messages.text: Do any Windows-savvy people know how to automate testing of what I assume is a permissions issue?

messages.text: I'm almost afraid to ask, but does the existence of an open 1.6 milestone mean there will have to be an RC4?  I'm not sure what to read into the open issue

elements.text: I'm almost afraid to ask, but does the existence of an open 1.6 milestone mean there will have to be an RC4?  I'm not sure what to read into the open issue

messages.text: There will be an RC4 if there are issues discovered in RC3 that we would consider blocking for a full release. Other things can go into a 1.6.1, for example. I wouldn't read into it _too_ much. :wink:

elements.text: There will be an RC4 if there are issues discovered in RC3 that we would consider blocking for a full release. Other things can go into a 1.6.1, for example. I wouldn't read into it
too
much.

messages.text: I'm having some troubles with libcurl, I think we should build it with `--enable-versioned-symbols`: <https://stackoverflow.com/a/56805774/2442087> this is what Linux distributions do (Debian: <https://salsa.debian.org/debian/curl/-/blob/4c763143767e46cb91069e496ff385810336e520/debian/rules#L16>; Archlinux: <https://github.com/archlinux/svntogit-packages/blob/e82f7544465e00a03a243345a9ebf0b4e686ab86/trunk/PKGBUILD#L32>).  CC: <@U66GD0880>
